title: Test Your Understanding: String Interpolation in JavaScript
description: See how well you understood template literals and string interpolation!

questions.question: What syntax is used for template literals in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Template literals use backticks (``) instead of single or double quotes.

questions.question: What syntax is used to embed expressions in template literals?
questions.explanation: Template literals use ${expression} to embed JavaScript expressions.

questions.question: Template literals can span multiple lines without using escape characters.
questions.explanation: True! Template literals preserve line breaks, making multi-line strings much easier.

questions.question: What is the result of: `Hello ${'World'}`?
questions.explanation: The expression ${'World'} is evaluated and replaced with 'World', resulting in 'Hello World'.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of template literals over string concatenation?
questions.explanation: Template literals offer better readability, multi-line support, and expression interpolation. Performance is generally similar to concatenation.

questions.question: What does this code output: `Price: $${10 + 5}`?
questions.explanation: The expression ${10 + 5} is evaluated to 15, resulting in 'Price: $15'.
